range.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a number of people or things that are all different, but are all of the same general type
range.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: students from a wide range of backgrounds
advice on a whole range of subjects
A fairly narrow range of people are responsible for key decisions.
The drug is effective against a range of bacteria.
range.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the limits within which amounts, quantities, ages etc vary
range.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Even the cheapest property was out of our price range (=too expensive for us).
toys suitable for children in the pre-school age range
Your blood pressure’s well within the normal range.
a salary in the range of $25,000 to $30,000
in the range (of) something to something
range.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a set of similar products made by a particular company or available in a particular shop
range.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The watches in this range are priced at £24.50.
We have a very large product range.
A company from Darlington has just launched its latest range of fashion jewellery.
range.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: the distance over which a particular weapon can hit things
range.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Both men had been shot at point-blank range.
missiles with a range of 3000 km
We waited until the enemy was within range.
I ducked down to get out of range of the gunshots.
range.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the distance within which something can be seen or heard
range.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: One way to see birds at close range is to attract them into your own garden.
a handsome man who drew admiring glances from any female within range
any spot within range of your radio signal
Joan hoped that the others were out of range of her mother’s voice.
range.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: the distance which a vehicle such as an aircraft can travel before it needs more fuel etc
range.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: The plane has a range of 3,600 miles.
range.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: all the musical notes that a particular singer or musical instrument can make
range.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: a group of mountains or hills, usually in a line
range.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: a land of high mountain ranges and deep valleys
the longest range of hills in the Lake District
range.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: an area of land where you can practise shooting or where weapons can be tested
range.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: the number of different things that someone, especially an actor or actress, does well
range.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: an actor of extraordinary range and intensity
range.translation[0].definitions[10].def: a large area of land covered with grass, on which cattle are kept
range.translation[0].definitions[12].def: a large piece of kitchen equipment in which you make a fire and use this heat to cook food
range.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: a number of people or things that are all different, but are all of the same general type
range.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The Institute organises talks on a wide range of topics.
He also supports a whole range of other charities.
A vast range of plants are used in medicines.
During his career he has run a diverse range of businesses.
They only had a very limited range of products available.
range.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 3: a set of similar products made by a particular company or available in a particular shop
range.translation[0].note_box[1].section: The store stocks a full range of groceries.
The winner will receive a brand-new kitchen from Magnet’s extensive range.
We offer a comprehensive range of services for the business traveller.
Body Blitz is a new range of toiletries specially designed for teenagers.
We need to broaden our product range.
These curtains are available in a much wider colour range.
range.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to include a variety of different things or people in addition to those mentioned
range.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: The show had a massive audience, ranging from children to grandparents.
range.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if prices, levels, temperatures etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between
range.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The shoes range in price from $25 to $100.
There were 120 students whose ages ranged from 10 to 18.
The population of these cities ranges between 3 and 5 million.
range.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to deal with a wide range of subjects or ideas in a book, speech, conversation etc
range.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: The conversation had ranged over a variety of topics, from sport to current affairs.
range.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to move around in an area without aiming for a particular place
range.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: Cattle ranged over the pastures in search of food.
range.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: to put things in a particular order or position
range.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: In the dining room, team photographs were ranged along the wall.
range.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the limits within which amounts, quantities etc can vary
range.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: We are looking at properties within a certain price range.
People in the 35 to 44 age range are most likely to hold more than one job.
Brokers typically charge commissions in the 4% to 8% range.
Sales will rise to a range of $12 million to $13 million.
range.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: the highest and lowest prices reached by a SECURITY (=bond, share etc) or market over a period of time
range.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: GM shares traded in the $37 to $42 range for most of last year.
range.translation[2].definitions[2].defi: a set of similar products made by a particular company or available in a particular shop
range.translation[2].definitions[2].exam: a wide range of products and systems
the top of the range (=best sold by a company or shop) Rucanor shoe
range.translation[2].definitions[3].defi: the area of power, responsibility, or activities that a person or organization has
range.translation[2].definitions[3].exam: These issues fall outside the range of the enquiry.
range.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: if prices, levels etc range from one amount to another, they include both those amounts and anything in between
range.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The judges’ salaries range from $82,000 to $99,000.
The population of these cities ranges between 3 and 5 million inhabitants.
The mainframe systems range in price from $1.3 million to $3.6 million.
